description: Set up a top level zone with an API/scheduler.  Create 2 child zones... but only start up one of them.  Build an instance.  When you do a 'show uuid' to the top level API, an exception will be returned because it can't query all child zones (1 is dead) even though the zone that has the UUID is alive and well.
title: scheduler api's reroute_compute should better handle cases where a child zone is dead
